quiz.title: Unit 1: Quiz 9
quiz.subtitle: Displacement-Time Graph Analysis - Both Motion Types
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: What is the displacement at time t = 2 seconds?
questions.explanation: At t = 2 seconds, the graph shows a displacement of 10 meters from the origin.

questions.question: What is the displacement at time t = 5 seconds?
questions.explanation: At t = 5 seconds, the displacement is 25 meters from the origin.

questions.question: What is the velocity of the object?
questions.explanation: Velocity = slope = rise/run. Using the endpoints: (25 m - 0 m) / (5 s - 0 s) = 25/5 = 5 m/s

questions.question: What is the nature of the motion shown in the graph?
questions.explanation: The straight line with constant slope indicates constant velocity motion.

questions.question: What is the displacement at time t = 0 seconds?
questions.explanation: The graph starts at the origin, so at t = 0 seconds, displacement = 0 m.

questions.question: How far does the object travel between t = 1 second and t = 4 seconds?
questions.explanation: At t = 1s: 5 m, at t = 4s: 20 m. Distance = 20 - 5 = 15 m

questions.question: What is the acceleration of the object?
questions.explanation: Since velocity is constant, acceleration = 0 m/s².

questions.question: If the motion continues at the same rate, what will be the displacement at t = 8 seconds?
questions.explanation: At 5 m/s, in 8 seconds: displacement = 5 m/s × 8 s = 40 m

questions.question: The velocity is highest at which time interval?
questions.explanation: The slope is steepest during 0-2 seconds, indicating the highest velocity.

questions.question: The velocity is lowest at which time interval?
questions.explanation: The slope is shallowest during 8-10 seconds, indicating the lowest velocity.

questions.question: The graph depicts a _____
questions.explanation: The changing slope indicates changing velocity, so non-uniform velocity.

questions.question: What is the displacement reached at 10 sec?
questions.explanation: At t = 10 seconds, the displacement is 29 meters from the origin.

questions.question: What does the graph indicate about the motion?
options: Object moves at constant velocity, then it decelerates
questions.explanation: The decreasing slope shows the object starts fast and gradually slows down.

questions.question: What is the average velocity?
questions.explanation: Average velocity = total displacement / total time = 29 m / 10 s = 2.9 m/s

questions.question: Does the graph show positive acceleration?
questions.explanation: No, the velocity is decreasing throughout (decreasing slope), so acceleration is negative.

questions.question: Does the graph show negative acceleration?
questions.explanation: Yes, the decreasing slope indicates negative acceleration (deceleration).

questions.question: Which of the following is likely to be true about the graph?
questions.explanation: The smooth curve suggests constant negative acceleration (deceleration).

questions.question: What is likely to be the speed at 1 second?
questions.explanation: At t = 1 second, the instantaneous velocity is approximately 10 m/s.

questions.question: Conceptual — What does a straight line on a displacement-time graph indicate?
questions.explanation: A straight line indicates constant slope, which means constant velocity.

questions.question: Conceptual — How is velocity calculated from a displacement-time graph?
questions.explanation: Velocity = change in displacement / change in time = slope of the displacement-time graph.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You master displacement-time graph analysis for both uniform and non-uniform motion!
scoreMessages.70: Strong work! You understand the key differences between constant and changing velocity motion.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress! Focus on understanding how slope relates to velocity in both straight and curved graphs.
scoreMessages.0: Review the fundamental concepts: slope = velocity, and how different graph shapes indicate different types of motion.
